DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: HORTON, K. E.;Horton, K;Horton, Kate;E Horton, Kate;E. HORTON, KATE;Horton, Kate E;HORTON, KATE E.;HORTON, K.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Kate Horton is a lecturer at the Federal University of Pernambuco Brazil, and a Research Associate at Erasmus University, Rotterdam, the Netherlands. She received her PhD from the Institute of Work Psychology, University of Sheffield, United Kingdom in 2011. Kate?s research interests include workplace identities and identification, organizational change, and roles and identities in the management accounting profession. Between 2010 and 2014, Kate was a Postdoc Researcher on the Composite Project, a large-scale EU research project that focused on policing change processes across 10 European countries. Kate is now a lecturer at the Federal University of Pernambuco, Brazil and a Research Associate at RSM, Erasmus University, the Netherlands.

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: INVESTIGATING THE NATURE OF ORGANISATIONAL IDENTIFICATION: WHAT ARE THE ANTECEDENTS AND CONSEQUENCES OF COMPLEX PATTERNS OF IDENTIFICATION IN THE WORKPLACE?

POS-DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

ENSINO.DISCIPLINA: Writing and publishing in international journals

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Career Sustainability in the Management Accounting Profession
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This research aims to explore the issue of career sustainability in the management accounting profession over time by identifying the mechanisms and actions adopted by accountants to keep the profession and their careers sustainable. The workplace is changing; Social and technological developments are changing our working lives and careers. The traditional career paths of the accounting profession are now no longer the norm. Employers are expecting more from those who join the profession and as individuals we are also seeking to have a professional role for a longer part of our lives, as the demographics of the working population change. The pace of change that we are experiencing in the profession is increasing and as individuals we need to be able to respond to that and to recognise the importance of sustaining our personal growth. While the role of the accountant remains potentially attractive in society, it is a role that increasingly changes and adapts. Lifelong adaptation is critical to survival. Therefore, we propose in this research to identify and understand how management accountants can overcome (multiple) role transitions, and how they can enact career paths that are multi-dimensional, elaborate, resilient and flexible (i.e., sustainable) in nature, enabling them to proactively prepare for desired role transitions and to more effectively respond to (undesired/enforced) work transitions over their career lifespans..

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: COMPOSITE (Comparative Police Studies in the EU)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Composite Project was a large-scale EU research project that focused on policing change processes across 10 European countries. The project included 15 institutions, including universities, consultancies and police organizations. It was funded by the European Union under the FP7 programme
